snippet: An executive order by President Obama gives some immigrants the chance to avoid deportation for two years, but its age requirements have split some families.
abstract: Executive order from the Obama administration temporarily stopping the deportation of illegal immigrants who came to the United States as children has brought a flood of young immigrants to apply for deferrals; order, however, applies only to those immigrants who came before they turned 16, leaving as many as 2.7 million illegal immigrants under age 30 ineligible, splitting families with siblings or spouses who fall on different sides of the cutoff.
lead_paragraph: An executive order by President Obama gives some immigrants the chance to avoid deportation for two years, but its age requirements have split some families.

keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)
keywords.name: subject
